channel.title: My client doesn't download the cache
channel.description:
I don't understand. I have the new CacheDownloader(this).downloadCache(); Under Starting Up in client.java, but it doesn't run?
[code] RS2 user client - release #317 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Insidious_Cache\main_file_cache.dat (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:55) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Insidious_Cache\main_file_cache.dat (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:55) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Insidious_Cache\Insidious_Cache.zip (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.downloadFile(CacheDownloader.java:81) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:56) at client.startUp(client.java:7501) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4914) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Insidious_Cache\Insidious_Cache.zip (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:123) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:57) at client.startUp(client.java:7501) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4914) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[/code]

item.title: My client doesn't download the cache
item.dc:creator: @J_P J_P
item.description:
@J_P wrote:

You are pointing the downloader to the wrong directories within the cache.

Read full topic
